question.text: RAAS is a system involving many organs. Which of these statements about RAAS is false?

options.text: It operates in response to decrease in blood pressure or blood volume
The JG cells release an enzyme renin which converts angiotensinogen into a peptide angiotensin I
Angiotensin II inhibits the release of aldosterone from adrenal gland
Angiotensin II increases blood pressure by causing arterioles to constrict

solution.text: RAAS - Renin Angiotensin Aldosterone System is a specialized response of the body in order to maintain the optimal blood pressure of the body. When the blood pressure falls it is sensed by the JG cells in the kidney. They release a hormone called Renin in response to this. Renin converts Angiotensinogen in to Angiotensin I. Angiotensin I is converted in Angiotensin II by enzyme ACE. Angiotensin II causes vascular constriction and stimulates adrenal cortex to release Aldosterone which causes water and salt retention and thus increase the blood pressure.
